rComments: What a boring teacher. Don't take the morning class for sure. He stares off into space while plinking around on the piano. I though he was a really sweet guy until he told me at the end of the semester that I would never make it in music. It'a been years but John would put his foot in his mouth twice over if he only knew. Life goes on!

This is the worst professor I had at UC Santa Cruz. Please, for your own benefit, DO NOT take a class this guy. He almost makes me want to vote Republican, just to de-fund all the taxpayer money going to such a joke of a teacher. Good for him, he lined up a good job, DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASSES.

Nice guy, slow pace, but fun and non-threatening class if you do the HW. One thing I really liked is that he emphasized that the only thing that is important in music is that it sounds good. He definitely wants you to do well.
Great Proffessor. Very witty and funny as well.

Sackett really should not be allowed to teach 100, he does not seem qualified. He cannot thoroughly explain a subject and often leaves his class more confused than before they walked in the door, and can't play most of the material on the piano, which frankly a university professor should be able to do. He should be restricted to music 13/14, no mo
Good teacher, I enjoyed his Musc.13 class.  It is not an easy class, and it isn't hard, a lot of relevant homework that he completely covers in class.

ONLY COMPETENT IN TEACHING REMEDIAL MUSIC THEORY. I learned NOTHING in his musc 100 class. before taking music 100, i was VERY interested in music theory and loved the subject. now, i detest it and i hate going to class. bring other hw to do in class while he tells meaningless stories. oh. and ask LOTS of questions. he doesn't know how to respond!

From my experience, Sackett seemed very uninterested in the class content, and it made class a big drag. We never started on time and hardly covered anything in class. We spent a lot of time sitting and waiting for him to go through papers and noodle around on the piano. Maybe he does better in classes higher than teaching people to read music.
I really like his class. Hes really a good teacher:)

John Sackett was possibly the worst teacher I've ever had.  Out of the 10 weeks of the quarter, we learned nothing for the first 4, and he only was prepared to start on time 2 or 3 times.  He couldn't play piano properly for eartraining; he never encouraged class participation; he made **** jokes; he ridiculed students; I learned nothing from him
great class ...especially easy if you have some basic music knowledge already--- john was very clear and helpful professor

John is a great instructor. At first I thought the class was gonna suck, but I soon came to enjoy his lectures and his nerdy humor. The HW is hard, but it really helped me learn the material. John was always willing to go over any questions and we learned alot. He was more than fair with late assignments and gave good (no surprises) tests.

I love John! He's absolutely hilarious with his cheesy jokes, and likes to pound unnecessariy on the piano to prove a point... I laugh at least once every class and thoroughly enjoy myself. I hate the homework but know it is good for me, and John is always willing to help. The only problem is he never lets us out of class time.... otherwise great!
john sackett is a fair teacher. gives daily hw assignments, weekly quizzes, and grades fair. willing to help if needed.

Stupid jokes that make you laugh and a true interest to help you learn if you don't get it.  Very accesible outside of class and genuinely wants to help students pass.  He will never go easy on you and that is a good thing.  No bs either.  He tells you wha

As hard as music theory was, I always looked forward to John's class.  Make sure you pay very close attention or you will miss some of the funniest, cheesiest jokes you have ever heard!  Especially great if there is somebody to egg him on...

John Sackett is one cool cat. He does a good job of explaining the concepts and doesn't move too fast. There is homework most of the time but nothing too bad and it really helps you to prepare for the tests. I keep hoping he'll leave his wife for me, but so far it hasn't happened...

His jokes make him THE MAN.  They are awful, but he tells them with such enthusiasm, you gotta love it.  Doing the homework sucks, but it does help, and he'll help get anyone through a tough spot understanding the material.  If you do the work, it's an easy class, and John's always entertaining.
Sackett is great!  Nice guy, always makes the class interesting, doesnt bore you to death.  Lots of homework every night but it's more than necessary to learn the stuff.  Overall solid teacher.

Sackett IS the man.  We have homework every night, but I feel like it is necessary practice, not busy work.  When the class did poorly on the homework, he did not just move on.  He is funny and we sing every day which is weird but fun.
No Comments

Dude, I don't know what you guys are talking about. Sackett is the man! The homework was a lot of busy work, but Sackett made it worthwhile. He has this funny nasally voice and has a lot of fun reading the names for attendance. He tells these ridiculous jokes. By the end you're best buds.

Sackett is one of the worst teachers I've ever had.He had no idea how to actually teach,he just gives assignments and grades.Rather than help me understand material he said in 5 years I'd look back & see all my mistakes: don't worry about it.Make sure you get a good TA if you have to take his class.

Is very clear, very thorough. If you have no music knowledge, you will come away with a very rich understanding of the basics. Great for filling in gaps in basic theory knowledge. Tells lame jokes, but whatever. They're a lot funnier by the end of the quarter. A little funnier, anyway.

Attendance & HW counts for everything in this class and music 13, which is unfortunate, because the lectures are boring and uninspired as is the material, which could be better learned on the internet in a few days.  Do yourself a favor and test out of it.  Also homework is horrible & every night.
